semigroups
Class Semigroup

java.lang.Object
  semigroups.Semigroup

public class Semigroup
extends java.lang.Object

A class to represent a discrete semigroup.

Author:
Felip Alˆez Nadal

Constructor Detail

Semigroup

public Semigroup(int[][] data)
Parameters:
data - is a matrix of integer which represents the multiplication table of the semigroup. The convenction here is that, for a semigroup of order n, the elements are labelled 1,2,3,...,n.

Method Detail

Elements

public int Elements()
Returns:
Returns the order of the semigroup

show

public void show()
Shows the multiplication table of the semigroup in a convenient way.

isAssociative

public boolean isAssociative()
Returns:
Returns true if the multiplication table is associative i.e. if the object is really a semigroup

isCommutative

public boolean isCommutative()
Returns:
Returns true if the semigroup is commutative

findZero

public int findZero()
Checks if the semigroup given has a zero element

Returns:
Returns -1 if the semigroup doesn't have a zero element, and the zero element otherwise.

readSemigroupFromFile

public static Semigroup readSemigroupFromFile(java.lang.String arxiu)
Loads all the semigroups which are saved in the data files

Returns:
A list with all the semigroups which have been loaded

loadFromFile

public static Semigroup[] loadFromFile()
Loads all the semigroups, from order 2 to 6. Returns an array of Semigroup objects.

isResonant

public boolean isResonant(Set s0,
                          Set s1)
Checks if a given decomposition of a semigroup is a resonant one

Parameters:
s0 -
s1 -
orden - the order of the semigroup
Returns:
Returns true if the given decomposition is resonant, false otherwise

findResonances

public Set[][] findResonances(int n1,
                              int n2)
Looks for all the resonant decomposition of a possible semigroup with n1 elements in S0 and n2 in S1

Parameters:
n1 - Number of elements of S0
n2 - Number of elements of S1
Returns:
Returns a list of 2-dimensional arrays of Set with format { Set S0 , Set S1 }. It means that for each element of the array (let's call it list), list[i][0] plays the role of S0 in the resonant decomposition and list[i][1] plays the role of S1.

findAllResonances

public Set[][] findAllResonances()
Looks for all possible resonant decomposition of the semigroup

Returns:
Returns a list of 2-dimensional arrays of Set with format { Set S0 , Set S1 }. It means that for each element of the array (let's call it list), list[i][0] plays the role of S0 in the resonant decomposition and list[i][1] plays the role of S1.

PermuteWith

public Semigroup PermuteWith(Set s)
Applies an isomorphism to the semigroup

Parameters:
s - is the Set which identifies the permutation to apply
Returns:
Returns a new Semigroup which is the result of applying the isomorphism

Permute

public Semigroup[] Permute()
Gives all the semigroups isomorphic to a given one

Returns:
A list containing all the isomorphic semigroups

AntiPermute

public Semigroup[] AntiPermute()
Applies all possible antiisomorphisms to the semigroup

Returns:
A list containing all the antiisomorphic semigroups

isotest

public boolean[] isotest(Semigroup B)
This methods tests for the existence of an isomorphism or antiisomorphism between the current object and the semigroup B.

Parameters:
B - is a semigroup which is believed to be isomorphic to the current one
Returns:
Return value mean: (false , false ) -> isomorphism or antiisomorphism don't exist.(true, true ) -> isomorphism exists. (true, false ) -> antiisomorphism exists

compare

int compare(Semigroup B)
Checks if the 2 semigroups are the same

Parameters:
B - the semigroup to check if is identic to the present one
Returns:
returns 1 if the semigroups are equal, 0 othercase

isEqualTo

public boolean isEqualTo(Semigroup B)
Checks if the 2 semigroups are the same

Parameters:
B - is a semigroup to check if its the same that the current one
Returns:
true if are equal, false othercase

transpose

public Semigroup transpose()
Returns a semigroup with a multiplication table which is transposed to the original one

isTemplateFor

public boolean isTemplateFor(Semigroup B)
We get a matrix with some empty spaces (given by -1 in the entry) and check if we can fill it with B

Parameters:
B - a semigroup which we want to check if can fill the template
Returns:
true if B fills the template

isIsoTemplateFor

public boolean isIsoTemplateFor(Semigroup B)
Checks if the template, or one of its isomorphism, is a good template for B

Parameters:
B -
Returns:
true in positive case

getExpandedStructureConstant

public ExpandedStructureConstantSet getExpandedStructureConstant(StructureConstantSet s)
Performs the S-expansion of a Lie algebra, represented by a StructureConstantSet object, by the current semigroup

Parameters:
s - represents the Lie algebra,
Returns:
a ExpandedStructureConstantSet object, with the result of the expansion
